pageDescription: Here you can access contract information about the various tokens in the Synthetix Network.

tokens.description: The Synthetix Network Token (SNX) gets staked as collateral to back Synths and entitles stakers to receive fees generated by Synth trades on Synthetix.Exchange.

Inversely tracks the price of Binance Coin (BNB) through price feeds supplied by an oracle. The entry point is $29 (the approximate market price at time of creation). This Synth freezes when it reaches its upper limit of $44 (i.e. when Binance Coin's value reaches $14.5) or its lower limit of $14.5 (i.e. when Binance Coin’s value reaches $44). If it reaches either of its limits and gets frozen, it will no longer be able to be purchased on Synthetix.Exchange, but can still be traded for other Synths at its frozen value. At some point after it has reached either of its limits, it will be substituted for another iBNB with different limits.

Inversely tracks the price of Bitcoin (BTC) through price feeds supplied by an oracle. The entry point is $10600 (the approximate market price at time of creation). This Synth freezes when it reaches its upper limit of $15900 (i.e. when Bitcoin's value reaches $5300) or its lower limit of $5300 (i.e. when Bitcoin’s value reaches $15900). If it reaches either of its limits and gets frozen, it will no longer be able to be purchased on Synthetix.Exchange, but can still be traded for other Synths at its frozen value. At some point after it has reached either of its limits, it will be substituted for another iBTC with different limits.

Inversely tracks the price of Centralised Exchange Index (CEX) through price feeds supplied by an oracle. The entry point is $1000 (the approximate market price at time of creation). This Synth freezes when it reaches its upper limit of $1500 (i.e. when CEX's value reaches $500) or its lower limit of $500 (i.e. when CEX’s value reaches $1500). If it reaches either of its limits and gets frozen, it will no longer be able to be purchased on Synthetix.Exchange, but can still be traded for other Synths at its frozen value. At some point after it has reached either of its limits, it will be substituted for another iCEX with different limits.

Inversely tracks the price of Ether (ETH) through price feeds supplied by an oracle. The entry point is $220 (the approximate market price at time of creation). This Synth freezes when it reaches its upper limit of $330 (i.e. when Ether's value reaches $110) or its lower limit of $110 (i.e. when Ether’s value reaches $330). If it reaches either of its limits and gets frozen, it will no longer be able to be purchased on Synthetix.Exchange, but can still be traded for other Synths at its frozen value. At some point after it has reached either of its limits, it will be substituted for another iETH with different limits.

Inversely tracks the price of Maker (MKR) through price feeds supplied by an oracle. The entry point is $550 (the approximate market price at time of creation). This Synth freezes when it reaches its upper limit of $825 (i.e. when MAKER's value reaches $275) or its lower limit of $275 (i.e. when MAKER’s value reaches $825). If it reaches either of its limits and gets frozen, it will no longer be able to be purchased on Synthetix.Exchange, but can still be traded for other Synths at its frozen value. At some point after it has reached either of its limits, it will be substituted for another iMKR with different limits.

Inversely tracks the price of TRON (TRX) through price feeds supplied by an oracle. The entry point is $0.025 (the approximate market price at time of creation). This Synth freezes when it reaches its upper limit of $0.0375 (i.e. when TRON's value reaches $0.0125) or its lower limit of $0.0125 (i.e. when TRON’s value reaches $0.0375). If it reaches either of its limits and gets frozen, it will no longer be able to be purchased on Synthetix.Exchange, but can still be traded for other Synths at its frozen value. At some point after it has reached either of its limits, it will be substituted for another iTRX with different limits.

Inversely tracks the price of Tezos (XTZ) through price feeds supplied by an oracle. The entry point is $1.4 (the approximate market price at time of creation). This Synth freezes when it reaches its upper limit of $2.1 (i.e. when Tezos's value reaches $0.7) or its lower limit of $0.7 (i.e. when Tezos’s value reaches $2.1). If it reaches either of its limits and gets frozen, it will no longer be able to be purchased on Synthetix.Exchange, but can still be traded for other Synths at its frozen value. At some point after it has reached either of its limits, it will be substituted for another iXTZ with different limits.
Tracks the price of Australian Dollars (AUD) through price feeds supplied by an oracle.
Tracks the price of Binance Coin (BNB) through price feeds supplied by an oracle.
Tracks the price of Bitcoin (BTC) through price feeds supplied by an oracle.

Tracks the price of the index: Centralised Exchange Index (CEX) through price feeds supplied by an oracle. This index is made up of the following assets and weights: 17.88 of BNB (Binance Coin), 153.85 of LEO (UNUS SED LEO), 20.51 of HT (Huobi Token), 32.52 of OKB, 59.82 of KCS (KuCoin Shares).
Tracks the price of Swiss Franc (CHF) through price feeds supplied by an oracle.
Tracks the price of Ether (ETH) through price feeds supplied by an oracle.
Tracks the price of Euros (EUR) through price feeds supplied by an oracle.
Tracks the price of Pound Sterling (GBP) through price feeds supplied by an oracle.
Tracks the price of Japanese Yen (JPY) through price feeds supplied by an oracle.
Tracks the price of Maker (MKR) through price feeds supplied by an oracle.
Tracks the price of Tron (TRX) through price feeds supplied by an oracle.
Tracks the price of a single US Dollar (USD). This Synth always remains constant at 1.
Tracks the price of Silver Ounce (XAG) through price feeds supplied by an oracle.
Tracks the price of Gold Ounce (XAU) through price feeds supplied by an oracle.
Tracks the price of Tezos (XTZ) through price feeds supplied by an oracle.
